text:
NAEB ENGINEERING COMMITTEE REPORTS
5
Publ.
No„
E-3 No. 3 Operating Techniques for Video Records - Keith K, Ketcham and
Herbert T, Krajewski
This report contains sections on "The Positive Sound Track,"
"Exposing the Positive Picture," "Exposing the Negative Picture,"
"Developing the Exposed Negative," "Printing the Negative,"
"Exposure Comparison," and "Some Difficulties Encountered."
July, 1953. 11 pp. Paper. 500
E-4 No. 4 Engineering Operations Problems Based on Three Years of Operation
WOI-TV
A survey of the problems encountered in television operations as
observed over a three-year period* The report contains sections
on "Film Slide Operation," "Addition of Live Net," and "Addition
of Live Studio Operation." November, 1953. 4 PP. Paper. 500
E-5 No, 5 The Theory of Video Recording - Joseph W. Belcher
This report is intended as a guide to making good video recordings
using standard techniques. There are sections on "Basic Theory,"
"Sensitometry," "Electrical Factors Influencing Exposure," "The
Need for Gamma Correction," "Film Standards," and "Sound."
March, 1954. 19 pp. Paper. 500
E-6 No. 6 NAEB Tape Recording - Carl Menzer
This report was written in an effort to improve the audio quality
of the programs supplied by the NAEB Network. There are sections
on "Amplifier Characteristics—Electrical," "Recording and Playback
Head Maintenance and Adjustment." April, 1954. 6 pp. Paper, 500
E-10 Complete Set, 4 Engineering Reports. $1.25
Q-10 Test Equipment Inventory - Cecil S. Bidlack, Editor
A detailed inventory of the test equipment in use at educational
radio and television stations and production centers including
station data and listing chief engineers. February, 1957. 37 pp*
Paper, $1.00
